body:
I'm trying to uninstall all of my installed packages. The process uninstalls a few hundred packages and then crashes with:
```
KeyError: 'libffi'
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack uninstall -ay
...
==> Error: Unable to read file: /Users/Adam/spack/opt/spack/darwin-catalina-x86_64/clang-11.0.3-apple/py-chardet-3.0.4-gqaa2mw2vk7fpx32f7fsmqh56i5daxp6/.spack/spec.yaml
Cause: 'libffi'
```

### Error Message

```console
$ spack -d uninstall -ay
...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/bin/spack", line 64, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 760, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 488, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/uninstall.py", line 348, in uninstall
    uninstall_specs(args, specs)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/uninstall.py", line 323, in uninstall_specs
    do_uninstall(env, uninstall_list, args.force)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/uninstall.py", line 225, in do_uninstall
    item.do_uninstall(force=force)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1769, in do_uninstall
    Package.uninstall_by_spec(self.spec, force)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1741, in uninstall_by_spec
    spack.hooks.pre_uninstall(spec)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/__init__.py", line 59, in __call__
    hook(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/hooks/extensions.py", line 18, in pre_uninstall
    if pkg.is_activated(view):
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1030, in is_activated
    exts = extensions_layout.extension_map(self.extendee_spec)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 431, in extension_map
    return self._extension_map(spec).copy()
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 456, in _extension_map
    by_hash = self.layout.specs_by_hash()
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 361, in specs_by_hash
    for spec in self.all_specs():
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 343, in all_specs
    return [self.read_spec(s) for s in spec_files]
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 343, in <listcomp>
    return [self.read_spec(s) for s in spec_files]
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/directory_layout.py", line 230, in read_spec
    spec = spack.spec.Spec.from_yaml(f)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1939, in from_yaml
    return Spec.from_dict(data)
  File "/Users/Adam/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1926, in from_dict
    deps[name]._add_dependency(deps[dname], dtypes)
KeyError: 'libffi'
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2-979-7e5874c250
* **Python:** 3.7.6
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-ivybridge

### Additional information

Could be related to #3690, but a completely different error message. Unfortunately, this isn't fixed by #16447. 

@aweits @alalazo may be interested in this.

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Leftover <prefix>/.spack/spec.yaml from failed installations
